page.title: 14REDDISH VALE LAND COVER
page.content: Our{tutor group}looked at three different sections of land. Just beyond a gate was the first piece of land. It was covered with rough grass and buttercups and was used for grazing horses.In the centre of the field were thistles and on the far side were hawthorn hedges and elderberry bushes. We saw two railway lines which crossed one another. The line from {Manchester}to{Sheffield}was bellow and the line from Staly bridge to {Stockport}was above. A cobbled road led nowhere. A coal mine in{Denton}closed in the 1920's. Wagons would come up the road loaded with coal. The second piece of space of land was used for grazing.{Fresian and{Jersey}dairy cows were eating the grass which covered the land. Some of the{valley}is waist ground.
